title: Daily Routine Verbs
context: A few core verbs cover most of your day: waking, working, studying, meeting, relaxing.
Add time words like 아침에 (in the morning) or 지금 (now) to give simple structure.
Object particles 을/를 attach to the thing you act on, but they often drop in speech.

sentences.english: I wake up in the morning and wash my face.
I work at the office. At lunch I meet a coworker.
In the evening I work out and rest.
I study Korean on the weekend.
I go to sleep around midnight.

explanation: Object particles: 을 after consonant (한국어를), 를 after vowel (커피를). They can drop if the meaning is clear: 한국어 공부해요.
-아서/어서 links actions in sequence with cause/flow: 일어나서 씻어요 = I wake up and wash (right after).
Company/workplace phrases often use 에서 to show where an action happens: 회사에서 일해요, 집에서 쉬어요.
Time markers: 아침에 (in the morning), 점심에 (at lunchtime), 저녁에 (in the evening), 밤에 (at night).
For routines, present tense alone implies habit: 주말에 운동해요 = I work out on weekends.

messages.speaker: 서연
messages.korean: 안녕하세요, 준호! 오늘 아침에 일어나서 씻어요?
messages.english: Hello, Junho! Do you wake up and wash in the morning?
messages.romanization: annyeonghaseyo, junho! oneul achime ireonaseo ssiseoyo?

messages.speaker: 준호
messages.korean: 네, 아침에 일어나서 씻어요. 지금 일해요.
messages.english: Yes, I wake up in the morning and wash. I'm working now.
messages.romanization: ne, achime ireonaseo ssiseoyo. jigeum ilhaeyo.

messages.speaker: 준호
messages.english: Yes, I rest at lunch. I work out in the evening.

messages.speaker: 서연
messages.english: Do you study in the evening? Do you meet Minho on the weekend?

messages.speaker: 준호
messages.korean: 네, 저녁에 공부해요. 공부하고 쉬어요. 밤에 잠자요.
messages.english: Yes, I study in the evening. I study and rest. I sleep at night.
messages.romanization: ne, jeonyeoge gongbuhaeyo. gongbuhago swieoyo. bame jamjayo.
